alert.note: Alert for Creek (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 9:06PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Creek, northwestern Okmulgee and northeastern Okfuskee Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 905 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Okfuskee, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okfuskee... Beggs... Slick... Preston... Okmulgee State Park... Welty... Mason... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 196 and 202. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
